message_1:
A delivery person needs to make deliveries to five different locations. The distances between the locations are given in the table below:

| Locations | Distance from Location |
|---------|:----------------:|
| A|        10|
| B|        15|
| C|        20|
| D|        25|
| E|        30|

If the delivery person starts at location A and wants to minimize the total distance traveled, what is the optimal order of deliveries for the person to make?
message_2:
To minimize the total distance traveled, the delivery person should visit the locations in the order of their distances from the starting point. In this case, the order would be:

A → B → C → D → E

This way, the delivery person will travel the shortest possible distance between each location. The total distance traveled will be:

10 (A to B) + 15 (B to C) + 20 (C to D) + 25 (D to E) = 70 units.
